intro: Salsola drummondii, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and disturbed soils. The plant has spiny stems and leaves, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It is well adapted to harsh conditions, with deep root systems that allow it to survive in poor soils and low moisture. Salsola drummondii is also known for its aggressive growth and is considered a weed in many regions.
